info.title: Supadata
info.description: Web & Social Media Content API for Developers

title.example: Rick Astley - Never Gonna Give You Up (Official Music Video)

description.example: The official music video for "Never Gonna Give You Up"...

error.description: Error code identifying the type of error

details.example: The request is invalid or malformed

description.example: A collection of my favorite videos

videoCount.description: Number of videos in the playlist

viewCount.description: Number of views for the playlist

lastUpdated.description: When the playlist was last updated

description.example: The official Rick Astley YouTube channel

videoCount.description: Number of videos on the channel

anyOf.description: Plain text transcript when text=true parameter is used
anyOf.example: Never gonna give you up, never gonna let you down...

anyOf.description: Plain text transcript when text=true parameter is used
anyOf.example: Nunca voy a abandonarte, nunca voy a decepcionarteâ€¦

status.description: Current status of the batch job

errorCode.description: Error code if processing this item failed

results.description: Array of results for each video in the batch

total.description: Total number of items in the batch

failed.description: Number of items that failed processing

stats.description: Statistics about the batch job progress

completedAt.description: Timestamp when the job completed, if status is completed

query.description: The search query that was executed
query.example: Rick Astley Never Gonna Give You Up

id.description: ID of the video, channel, or playlist

title.example: Rick Astley - Never Gonna Give You Up (Official Video)

description.example: The official music video for Rick Astley...

videoCount.description: Video count (for channels and playlists only)

nextPageToken.description: Token for fetching the next page of results. Only returned when limit parameter is not provided.

content.description: The Markdown content extracted from the URL
content.example:
# Supadata
## What is Supadata?
Supadata is an API platform for data extraction for LLM training.

name.example: Supadata: Web & YouTube to text API for developers

description.example: Supadata is one stop-shop API for developers to read web and YouTube content, ready for AI training and retrieval.

ogUrl.description: Open Graph URL for the webpage

countCharacters.description: The number of characters in the content

urls.description: List of URLs found on the webpage
List of URLs found on the webpage

status.description: The status of the crawl job

content.description: The Markdown content extracted from the URL
content.example:
# Supadata
## What is Supadata?
Supadata is an API platform for data extraction for LLM training.

name.example: Supadata: Web & YouTube to text API for developers

description.example: Supadata is one stop-shop API for developers to read web and YouTube content, ready for AI training and retrieval.

ogUrl.description: Open Graph URL for the webpage

countCharacters.description: The number of characters in the content

pages.description: List of pages that were crawled (only present when status is completed)

next.description: URL for fetching the next page of results

TranscriptOrJobId.description: Either a transcript result (synchronous) or a job ID (asynchronous).

error.description: Error information if the job failed

anyOf.description: Plain text transcript when text=true parameter is used
anyOf.example: Never gonna give you up, never gonna let you down...

schema.description: YouTube video URL or ID. See [supported URL formats](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-url-formats).

get.description: Get metadata for a YouTube video.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
video = supadata.youtube.video(
    id="https://youtu.be/dQw4w9WgXcQ" # can be id or url
)
print(f"Video title: {video.title}")
print(f"Channel: {video.channel.name}")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/youtube/video?id=https://youtu.be/dQw4w9WgXcQ" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

schema.description: YouTube playlist URL or ID. See [supported URL formats](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-url-formats).

get.description: Get metadata for a YouTube playlist.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
playlist = supadata.youtube.playlist(
    id="https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLlaN88a7y2_plecYoJxvRFTLHVbIVAOoc" # can be id or url
)
print(f"Playlist title: {playlist.title} contains {playlist.video_count} videos")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/youtube/playlist?id=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLlaN88a7y2_plecYoJxvRFTLHVbIVAOoc" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

schema.description: YouTube playlist URL or ID. See [supported URL formats](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-url-formats).
Maximum number of video IDs to return

get.description: Get video IDs from a YouTube playlist.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
videos = supadata.youtube.playlist.videos(
    id="https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLlaN88a7y2_plecYoJxvRFTLHVbIVAOoc", # can be id or url
    limit=20  # Optional: limit the number of videos to fetch
)
print(f"Found {len(videos.video_ids)} videos")
print(videos.video_ids)

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/youtube/playlist/videos?id=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLlaN88a7y2_plecYoJxvRFTLHVbIVAOoc&limit=20" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

schema.description: YouTube channel URL, handle or ID. See [supported URL formats](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-url-formats).

get.description: Get metadata for a YouTube channel.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
channel = supadata.youtube.channel(
    id="RickAstleyVEVO" # can be url, id, handle
)
print(f"Channel name: {channel.name}")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/youtube/channel?id=RickAstleyVEVO" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

schema.description: YouTube channel URL, handle or ID. See [supported URL formats](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-url-formats).
Maximum number of video IDs to return. If type = all, vertical videos are prioritized.
Type of videos to return.

get.description: Get video IDs from a YouTube channel.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
videos = supadata.youtube.channel.videos(
    id="RickAstleyVEVO", # can be url, id, handle
    limit=50,  # Optional: limit the number of videos to fetch
    type="all" # Optional: 'all', 'video', 'short', 'live'  (default 'all')
)
print(f"Found {len(videos.video_ids)} regular videos, {len(videos.short_ids)} shorts, and {len(videos.live_ids)} live streams.")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/youtube/channel/videos?id=RickAstleyVEVO&limit=50&type=all" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

schema.description: YouTube video URL. See [supported URL formats](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-url-formats).
YouTube video ID. Alternative to URL.
When true, returns plain text transcript.
Maximum characters per transcript chunk (only when text=false)

Preferred language code of the transcript (ISO 639-1). If not provided, the first available language will be returned. If the requested language is unavailable, the API defaults to the first available language. See [Languages](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-language-codes).

get.description: Get transcript from YouTube video in various formats and languages. If the `lang` parameter is not provided or the transcript is not available in the requested language, the API defaults to the first available language.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
text_transcript = supadata.youtube.transcript(
    url="https://youtu.be/dQw4w9WgXcQ",
    text=True # Set to False to get the transcript with timestamps
)
print(text_transcript.content)

x-codeSamples.label: cURL - Using URL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/youtube/transcript?url=https://youtu.be/dQw4w9WgXcQ" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

schema.description: YouTube video URL. See [supported URL formats](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-url-formats).
YouTube video ID. Alternative to URL.
When true, returns plain text transcript.
Maximum characters per transcript chunk (only when text=false)
Language code for translation (ISO 639-1). See [Languages](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-language-codes).

get.description: Translate YouTube video transcript into different languages.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
translated = supadata.youtube.translate(
    url="https://youtu.be/dQw4w9WgXcQ",
    lang="es"
)
print(f"Got translated transcript in {translated.lang}")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/youtube/transcript/translate?url=https://youtu.be/dQw4w9WgXcQ&lang=es" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

post.description: Create a batch job to get transcripts of multiple YouTube videos

videoIds.description: Array of YouTube video IDs or URLs

playlistId.description: YouTube playlist URL or ID. See [supported URL formats](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-url-formats).

channelId.description: YouTube channel URL, handle or ID. See [supported URL formats](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-url-formats).

limit.description: Maximum number of videos to process (when using playlistId or channelId)

lang.description: Preferred language code of the transcript (ISO 639-1). If not provided, the first available language will be returned. If the requested language is unavailable, the API defaults to the first available language. See [Languages](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-language-codes).

text.description: When true, returns plain text transcript.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata, SupadataError

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")

transcript_batch = supadata.youtube.transcript.batch(
    video_ids=["dQw4w9WgXcQ", "xvFZjo5PgG0"],
    # playlist_id="PLlaN88a7y2_plecYoJxvRFTLHVbIVAOoc" # alternatively
    # channel_id="UC_9-kyTW8ZkZNDHQJ6FgpwQ" # alternatively
    lang="en",
    text=True
)
print(f"Started transcript batch job: {transcript_batch.job_id}")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/youtube/transcript/batch" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "videoIds": ["dQw4w9WgXcQ", "xvFZjo5PgG0"],
    "lang": "en",
    "text": true
  }'

post.description: Create a batch job to fetch metadata of multiple YouTube videos

videoIds.description: Array of YouTube video IDs or URLs

playlistId.description: YouTube playlist URL or ID. See [supported URL formats](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-url-formats).

channelId.description: YouTube channel URL, handle or ID. See [supported URL formats](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-url-formats).

limit.description: Maximum number of videos to process (when using playlistId or channelId)

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata, SupadataError

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")

batch_job = supadata.youtube.video.batch(
    video_ids=["dQw4w9WgXcQ", "xvFZjo5PgG0", "L_jWHffIx5E"]
    # playlist_id="PLlaN88a7y2_plecYoJxvRFTLHVbIVAOoc" # alternatively
    # channel_id="UC_9-kyTW8ZkZNDHQJ6FgpwQ" # alternatively
)
print(f"Started batch job: {batch_job.job_id}")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL

200.description: Successfully retrieved the status and results (if completed)

get.description: Get the status and results of a YouTube batch job.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata, SupadataError

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")

batch_results = supadata.youtube.batch.get_batch_results(job_id=JOB_ID)
print(batch_results)

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/youtube/batch/JOB_ID" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

schema.description: Search query string
Filter by upload date (eg. last month). Note: works only for videos and movies.
Filter by content type
Filter by video duration: short (<4min), medium (4-20min), long (>20min). Note: works only for videos and movies.
Sort order of search results.
Array of special features to filter by. Note: works only for videos and movies.

Maximum number of results to return. When provided, the API will automatically paginate to fetch up to this many results. When omitted, returns a single page with `nextPageToken` for manual pagination.
Token for fetching the next page of results. When provided, other filter parameters are ignored.

get.description: Search YouTube for videos, channels, and playlists with advanced filters.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
search_results = supadata.youtube.search(
    query="rick astley never gonna give you up",
    type="video",  # Optional: 'video', 'channel', 'playlist', 'all' (default 'all')
    limit=20,  # Optional: get more than the first page of results
    sort_by="views",  # Optional: 'relevance', 'rating', 'date', 'views'
    upload_date="year",  # Optional: 'hour', 'today', 'week', 'month', 'year'
    duration="medium"  # Optional: 'short', 'medium', 'long'
)
print(f"Found {len(search_results.results)} results")
for result in search_results.results:
    print(f"{result.type}: {result.title}")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/youtube/search?query=rick%20astley%20never%20gonna%20give%20you%20up&type=video&limit=20&sortBy=views&uploadDate=month" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

schema.description: When true, removes markdown links from the content, leaving only the URL text.
Preferred language for the scraped content (ISO 639-1 code). Sets Accept-Language header to influence website language selection.

get.description: Extract content from any web page to Markdown format.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
web_content = supadata.web.scrape("https://example.com")
print(f"Page content: {web_content.content}")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/web/scrape?url=https://example.com" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

schema.description: When true, removes markdown links from the content, leaving only the URL text.
Preferred language for the scraped content (ISO 639-1 code). Sets Accept-Language header to influence website language selection.

get.description: Extract all links found on a whole website.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")
site_map = supadata.web.map("https://example.com")
print(f"Found {len(site_map.urls)} URLs")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/web/map?url=https://example.com" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

post.description: Create a crawl job to extract content from all pages on a website.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata, SupadataError

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")

# Start a crawl job
crawl_job = supadata.web.crawl(
    url="https://example.com",
    limit=10  # Optional: limit the number of pages to crawl
)
print(f"Started crawl job: {crawl_job.job_id}")

# Get crawl results
# This automatically handles pagination and returns all pages
try:
    pages = supadata.web.get_crawl_results(job_id=crawl_job.job_id)
    for page in pages:
        print(f"Crawled page: {page.url}")
        print(f"Page title: {page.name}")
        print(f"Content: {page.content}")
except SupadataError as e:
    print(f"Crawl job failed: {e}")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL - Start Crawl
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/web/crawl" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "url": "https://example.com",
    "limit": 10
  }'

x-codeSamples.label: cURL - Get Crawl Results
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/web/crawl/JOB_ID" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

url.description: URL of the website to crawl

limit.description: Maximum number of pages to crawl

get.description: Get the status and results of a crawl by job ID.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata, SupadataError

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")

# Start a crawl job
crawl_job = supadata.web.crawl(
    url="https://example.com",
    limit=10  # Optional: limit the number of pages to crawl
)
print(f"Started crawl job: {crawl_job.job_id}")

# Get crawl results
# This automatically handles pagination and returns all pages
try:
    pages = supadata.web.get_crawl_results(job_id=crawl_job.job_id)
    for page in pages:
        print(f"Crawled page: {page.url}")
        print(f"Page title: {page.name}")
        print(f"Content: {page.content}")
except SupadataError as e:
    print(f"Crawl job failed: {e}")

x-codeSamples.label: cURL - Start Crawl
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/web/crawl" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "url": "https://example.com",
    "limit": 10
  }'

x-codeSamples.label: cURL - Get Crawl Results
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/web/crawl/JOB_ID" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

schema.description: Video URL from any supported platform (YouTube, TikTok, Twitter, Instagram) or a file URL.

Preferred language code of the transcript (ISO 639-1). If not provided, the first available language will be returned. If the requested language is unavailable, the API defaults to the first available language. See [Languages](https://supadata.ai/documentation/youtube/supported-language-codes).
When true, returns plain text transcript.
Maximum characters per transcript chunk (only when text=false)

Transcript mode: `native` (only fetch existing transcript), `generate` (always generate transcript using AI), or `auto` (try native, fallback to generate if unavailable). If url is a file URL, mode is always `generate`.

get.description: Get transcript from a supported video platform (YouTube, TikTok, Twitter, Instagram) or file URL. If the video is too large to return transcript immediately, request returns a job ID. Use the `/transcript/:jobId` endpoint to get job results.

x-codeSamples.label: Node.js
Python
x-codeSamples.source:
from supadata import Supadata

supadata = Supadata(api_key="YOUR_API_KEY")

# Get transcript or job ID
transcript_result = supadata.transcript(
    url="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dQw4w9WgXcQ",
    lang="en",
    text=True,
    mode="auto"  # 'native', 'auto', or 'generate'
)
print(f"Got transcript result or job ID: {transcript_result}")

if hasattr(transcript_result, 'job_id'):
    # Check job result
    result = supadata.transcript.get_job_status(transcript_result.job_id)
    print(f"Job status: {result.status}")
    if result.status == "completed":
        print(result.content)

x-codeSamples.label: cURL - Get Transcript
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/transcript?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DdQw4w9WgXcQ&lang=en&text=true&mode=auto" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

x-codeSamples.label: cURL - Get Job Status
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/transcript/JOB_ID" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"

get.description: Get results for a transcript job by job ID.

x-codeSamples.label: cURL - Get Job Status
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X GET "https://api.supadata.ai/v1/transcript/JOB_ID" \
  -H "x-api-key: YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json"
